Inspired by her mother's passion for fashion, Cindy started to work in the modeling industry in 1986. She was also the host of the popular TV show, 'Entertainment Tonight' from 1991 to 1998 and starred in her own show, 'Cindy's Class', in 1994.

Aside from her modeling and TV career, Cindy has been a successful entrepreneur, author, and philanthropist. She has written several best-selling books, including 'Yes!: Are You Curious?' in 1994, 'Cindy's Workout Book' in 2001, and 'Cindy: My Life, My Body, My Way' in 2006.

Cindy Crawford has been an advocate for breast cancer awareness and regularly participates in charity events and fundraisers. Through her work with the Avon Foundation for Women, she has helped raise millions of dollars for breast cancer research and programs.

She made her directorial debut with the 2007 romantic comedy "Marci X," in which she also starred alongside her husband, Randy Couture.

Despite the glamorous exterior, Cindy Crawford has remained down-to-earth and involved in philanthropic efforts. She co-founded the Cindy Crawford Foundation in 1999, which supports organizations fighting hunger, helping children, and providing medical treatment for underserved populations. Crawford has also been a vocal advocate for women's rights, mental health, and environmental issues.
